title: Mayflytaur
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                           |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Half insect, half human, Mayflytaurs have incredibly short lifespans but have evolved to be exceptionally overpowered in just about every imaginable way. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **[Short Lifespan](/Short_Lifespan "Short Lifespan"):** Mayflytaurs are easily found by Zot; their [Zot clock](/Zot_clock "Zot clock") runs 10 times faster.
- **[Passive Mapping](/Passive_Mapping "Passive Mapping") 1:** Mayflytaurs can sense parts of the layout of the dungeon around them.
- **[Big Wings](/Big_Wings "Big Wings"):** Mayflytaurs can fly.
- **[Damage Reduction](/Deep_Dwarf#Damage_Reduction "Deep Dwarf"):** Mayflytaurs suffer less damage from every source. This applies separately to every source of damage, every time it is dealt; for instance, damage shaving generally negates the effects of all but the worst cases of being [poisoned](/Poison "Poison").

Mayflytaurs have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 9, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 9, and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 9 (before [background](/Background "Background") modifiers). They start with an extra [MP](/MP "MP") point.

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Adventurers:** [Delver](/Delver "Delver") and [Wanderer](/Wanderer "Wanderer")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [strength](/Strength "Strength"), [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), or [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") (equal chance) every 3rd level.
- 20% more [HP](/HP "HP") than average.
- +5 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.
- At level 6, gain [Mana Regeneration](/Mana_Regeneration "Mana Regeneration") 1.
- At levels 9 and 18, your Passive Mapping is upgraded to ranks 2 and 3, respectively.
- At level 12, gain [Regeneration](/Regeneration_\(mutation\) "Regeneration (mutation)") 1.
- At level 14, gain [Life Protection](/Life_Protection "Life Protection") 1.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Mayflytaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species") • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • **[Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species")** |

Thanks to their extremely restrictive turn conducts, playing like any other character is outright impossible. Mayflytaurs would often have to skip floors and imploy [meta turncount strategies](/Speedrun "Speedrun") just to live. These tactics also tend to make My players underleveled, even with their obscene stats.

## Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|               [Skill](/Skill "Skill")              | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                    ***Attack***                    |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|          [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")          |                 1                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                                1 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                                2 |
|          [Short Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                 3                |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                                1 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                                1 |
|           [Long Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                 3                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                                3 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                2 |
|              [Axes](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                 1                |         [Stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing")        |                              n/a | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                         |                              n/a |
|         [Maces & Flails](/Weapon "Weapon")         |                 3                |          [Shields](/Shields "Shields")          |                                1 | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                                2 |
|            [Polearms](/Weapon "Weapon")            |                 3                |    [Traps](/Traps_\(skill\) "Traps (skill)")    |                              n/a | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                1 |
|      [Staves](/Magical_staff "Magical staff")      |                 3                |                                                 |                                  | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                                2 |
| [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") |                 3                |                                                 |                                  | [Transmutation](/Transmutation "Transmutation")    |                                1 |
|                                                    |                                  |      [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")     |                                1 |                                                    |                                  |
|          [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")          |                 2                |       [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")       |                                1 | [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")          |                                2 |
|             [Slings](/Weapon "Weapon")             |                 3                |       [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")       |                                1 | [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")             |                                1 |
|              [Bows](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                 2                |    [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")    |                                1 |                                                    |                                  |
|            [Crossbows](/Weapon "Weapon")           |                 2                |   [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic")  |                                1 | [Experience](/Experience "Experience")             |                                0 |

## History

- Mayflytaurs were [added](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/commit/ad05b8d81) on 1 April 2022 and removed on the next day. 26 players managed to win 32 out of 736 games (4.35% win rate), and Sapher got a new best [score](/Score "Score") result with a [MyTm](https://underhound.eu/crawl/morgue/Sapher/morgue-Sapher-20220415-104228.txt).
- Mayflytaurs originate from hellmonk's [fork](/Variants#bloatcrawl2 "Variants"), [bloatcrawl2](https://github.com/Hellmonk/bloatcrawl2). As it was forked before the introduction of the [Zot clock](/Zot_clock "Zot clock"), Mayflytaurs instead immediately die after turn 20,000. They don't gain passive mutations, but have a different set of aptitudes (most skills are +4).

| [Species](/Species "Species") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Simple                        | [Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf") • [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") • [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk") • [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") • [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian") • [Troll](/Troll "Troll") • [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") • [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") • [Gnoll](/Gnoll "Gnoll") |
| Intermediate                  | [Human](/Human "Human") • [Kobold](/Kobold "Kobold") • [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") • [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni") • [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan") • [Ghoul](/Ghoul "Ghoul") • [Tengu](/Tengu "Tengu") • [Oni](/Oni "Oni") • [Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi")                                                    |
| Advanced                      | [Coglin](/Coglin "Coglin") • [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") • [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") • [Demigod](/Demigod "Demigod") • [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid") • [Naga](/Naga "Naga") • [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode") • [Felid](/Felid "Felid") • [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy")                               |
html:
Mayflytaur

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Half insect, half human, Mayflytaurs have incredibly short lifespans but have evolved to be exceptionally overpowered in just about every imaginable way.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 History

Innate Abilities

  • Short Lifespan: Mayflytaurs are easily found by Zot; their Zot clock runs 10 times faster.
  • Passive Mapping 1: Mayflytaurs can sense parts of the layout of the dungeon around them.
  • Big Wings: Mayflytaurs can fly.
  • Damage Reduction: Mayflytaurs suffer less damage from every source. This applies separately to every source of damage, every time it is dealt; for instance, damage shaving generally negates the effects of all but the worst cases of being poisoned.

Mayflytaurs have a base Strength of 9, Intelligence of 9, and Dexterity of 9 (before background modifiers). They start with an extra MP point.

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Adventurers: Delver and Wanderer

Level Bonuses

  • +1 strength, intelligence, or dexterity (equal chance) every 3rd level.
  • 20% more HP than average.
  • +5 willpower per level.
  • At level 6, gain Mana Regeneration 1.
  • At levels 9 and 18, your Passive Mapping is upgraded to ranks 2 and 3, respectively.
  • At level 12, gain Regeneration 1.
  • At level 14, gain Life Protection 1.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Mayflytaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Thanks to their extremely restrictive turn conducts, playing like any other character is outright impossible. Mayflytaurs would often have to skip floors and imploy meta turncount strategies just to live. These tactics also tend to make My players underleveled, even with their obscene stats.

Skill aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 1 Armour 1 Spellcasting 2
Short Blades 3 Dodging 1 Conjurations 1
Long Blades 3 Stealth 3 Hexes 2
Axes 1 Stabbing n/a Charms n/a
Maces & Flails 3 Shields 1 Summonings 2
Polearms 3 Traps n/a Necromancy 1
Staves 3 Translocations 2
Unarmed Combat 3 Transmutation 1
Fire Magic 1
Throwing 2 Ice Magic 1 Invocations 2
Slings 3 Air Magic 1 Evocations 1
Bows 2 Earth Magic 1
Crossbows 2 Poison Magic 1 Experience 0

History

  • Mayflytaurs were added on 1 April 2022 and removed on the next day. 26 players managed to win 32 out of 736 games (4.35% win rate), and Sapher got a new best score result with a MyTm.
  • Mayflytaurs originate from hellmonk's fork, bloatcrawl2. As it was forked before the introduction of the Zot clock, Mayflytaurs instead immediately die after turn 20,000. They don't gain passive mutations, but have a different set of aptitudes (most skills are +4).
Species
Simple Mountain Dwarf • Minotaur • Merfolk • Gargoyle • Draconian • Troll • Deep Elf • Armataur • Gnoll
Intermediate Human • Kobold • Demonspawn • Djinni • Spriggan • Ghoul • Tengu • Oni • Barachi
Advanced Coglin • Vine Stalker • Vampire • Demigod • Formicid • Naga • Octopode • Felid • Mummy

{{flavour|Half insect, half human, Mayflytaurs have incredibly short lifespans but have evolved to be exceptionally overpowered in just about every imaginable way.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*'''[[Short Lifespan]]:''' Mayflytaurs are easily found by Zot; their [[Zot clock]] runs 10 times faster.
*'''[[Passive Mapping]] 1:''' Mayflytaurs can sense parts of the layout of the dungeon around them.
*'''[[Big Wings]]:''' Mayflytaurs can fly.
*'''[[Deep Dwarf#Damage Reduction|Damage Reduction]]:''' Mayflytaurs suffer less damage from every source. This applies separately to every source of damage, every time it is dealt; for instance, damage shaving generally negates the effects of all but the worst cases of being [[poison]]ed.

Mayflytaurs have a base [[Strength]] of 9, [[Intelligence]] of 9, and [[Dexterity]] of 9 (before [[background]] modifiers). They start with an extra [[MP]] point.

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Adventurers:''' [[Delver]] and [[Wanderer]]

==Level Bonuses==
*+1 [[strength]], [[intelligence]], or [[dexterity]] (equal chance) every 3rd level.
*20% more [[HP]] than average.
*+5 [[willpower]] per level.
*At level 6, gain [[Mana Regeneration]] 1.
*At levels 9 and 18, your Passive Mapping is upgraded to ranks 2 and 3, respectively.
*At level 12, gain [[Regeneration (mutation)|Regeneration]] 1.
*At level 14, gain [[Life Protection]] 1.

==Starting Skills and Equipment==
Mayflytaurs start with the skills and equipment listed for their background.

==Difficulty of Play==
{{Hard}}
Thanks to their extremely restrictive turn conducts, playing like any other character is outright impossible. Mayflytaurs would often have to skip floors and imploy [[speedrun|meta turncount strategies]] just to live. These tactics also tend to make My players underleveled, even with their obscene stats.

==History==
*Mayflytaurs were [https://github.com/crawl/crawl/commit/ad05b8d81 added] on 1 April 2022 and removed on the next day. 26 players managed to win 32 out of 736 games (4.35% win rate), and Sapher got a new best [[score]] result with a [https://underhound.eu/crawl/morgue/Sapher/morgue-Sapher-20220415-104228.txt MyTm].
*Mayflytaurs originate from hellmonk's [[variants#bloatcrawl2|fork]], [https://github.com/Hellmonk/bloatcrawl2 bloatcrawl2]. As it was forked before the introduction of the [[Zot clock]], Mayflytaurs instead immediately die after turn 20,000. They don't gain passive mutations, but have a different set of aptitudes (most skills are +4).
